data.title: Uncaught Error: connect ETIMEDOUT & Uncaught Error: socket hang up
data.body:
**Atom Version**: 0.170.0
**System**: linux 3.16.0-4-amd64
**Thrown From**: Atom Core**

The bug seems pretty spontaneous, I did not use atom when the error occurred.
The message box `Create issue on atom/atom` appeared a lot of times.
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: connect ETIMEDOUT

```
At stream.js:94

Error: connect ETIMEDOUT
  at exports._errnoException (util.js:746:11)
  at Object.afterConnect [as oncomplete] (net.js:990:19)

```

If I scroll a little bit on the list of message boxes, I see a second bug which also occurs many times:
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: socket hang up

```
At events.js:85

Error: socket hang up
  at createHangUpError (_http_client.js:214:15)
  at TLSSocket.socketCloseListener (_http_client.js:246:23)
  at TLSSocket.emit (events.js:129:20)
  at TCP.close (net.js:469:12)

```

The commands preceding the two issues are the same:
### Commands

```
  3x -4:03.3 beautify:beautify-editor (atom-text-editor.editor)
  2x -2:24.0 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
     -2:07.7 beautify:beautify-editor (ol.tree-view.full-menu.list-tree.has-collapsable-children.focusable-panel)

     -0:18.1 beautify:beautify-editor (ol.tree-view.full-menu.list-tree.has-collapsable-children.focusable-panel)
     -0:10.1 core:save (atom-text-editor.editor)
  2x -0:00.0 beautify:beautify-editor (ol.tree-view.full-menu.list-tree.has-collapsable-children.focusable-panel)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "disabledPackages": [
      "autoclose-html",
      "language-coffee-script",
      "language-python-django-templates",
      "autocomplete-plus"
```

data.title: Atom.open opens new window even if newWindow is set to false.
data.body:
Hi, I am bit confused about atom.open with newWindow option.

If I open the console and try running atom.open({'pathsToOpen': ['test.txt'], 'newWindow': false});  Test.txt opens in new window even though newWindow is set to false. If I run same command with absoluthe path to file, file opens in same window. I am curious if that's what this part of documentation is talking about:

> .newWindow A Boolean, true to always open a new window instead of reusing existing windows  **depending on the paths to open.**

So you need to provide absoluth path in order for file to open in same window?

data.title: Can't open files owned by root
data.body: I'm on Linux Debian 8, Atom v0.174.0. When I try to open a file (`/etc/hosts`) that is owned by root, either by - `file-menu->open file` - pressing Ctrl-O, navigating to the file and double-click it - dragging a file onto the atom window - typing `atom ` from a command line I get an error notification saying `Permission denied: `, even though the file has permissions `644`, so reading is permitted for everyone. No messages in the console Then I tried to `sudo atom `, expecting a new atom window would open with root permissions, with also the file opened, but instead atom tried to open the file in the atom window that was already open (without root permissions), and I got the same error. So then I tried just `sudo atom`, expecting again that a new window with root permissions would open, only to find out that it opened a new window without root permissions. This does work, however, when no other atom window is already open. This means that when I just want to read a file owned by root, I have to shut down all other atom windows, then open up another window with root permissions and open the file. Now I'm risking saving edits to a file I just want to read.

data.title: coffeescript highlighting syntax error
data.body:
source code:

```
matches = body.match /lbxsh">(.+?)<\/[\s\S]+?lbzyh">(.+?)<\/[\s\S]+?lbbh">(.+?)<\/[\s\S]+?Lbxh">(.+?)<\/[\s\S]+?tbxsxm.+?value="(.+?)"[\s\S]+?selected" value="\d*">(.+?)<\/[\s\S]+?selected" value="\d*">(.+?)<\/[\s\S]+?tbpycc.+?value="(.+?)"[\s\S]+?tbrxrq.+?value="(.+?)"[\s\S]+?tbsfzh.+?value="(.+?)"/
unless matches
  console.error body
  return callback '未知错误，请稍后重试。'
matches = _.map matches, (match) ->
  return if match is '(请选择)' then null else match
```

data.title: Can't click or drag to select text when theme is using atom-text-editor
data.body: When theme is using atom-text-editor instead of the .editor class I can't click or drag to select any text. When I change back to the "soon to be depreciated" .editor class and reload Atom, I can select text again like normal.

data.title: Ctrl-0 doesn't reset the font-size zoom back to 100%
data.body:
According to Key Binding Resolver (actived w/ <kbd>ctrl + .</kbd>), it tells me that <kbd>ctrl + 0</kbd> resolves to `tree-view:toggle-focus` first and below that it resolves to `window:reset-font-size` which is really what I want.

My first attempt on fixing this, I tried to look for "Atom/resources/app/node_modules/tree-view/keymaps/tree-view.json" which is the file listed by keybind resolver but when I try to actually find this file in my atom folder that file doesn't actually exist!

Any idea how to reset the font zoom back to the default 100%? Why does the resolver point to a non-existing file for the tree toggle focus setting? Where does atom actually get this setting from if not from that non-existing file?

data.title: Gigantic menu fonts on HiDPI (Linux, GNOME)
data.body:
I see that HiDPI support appears to mostly work in Atom, but with `org.gnome.desktop.interface` set to `2`, atom launches with menu items of a crazy size:

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/218205/5790894/a9baed6a-9eaf-11e4-8534-27727a242867.png)

Launching atom with `--force-device-scale-factor=1` appears to have no effect.

```
$ atom --version
0.174.0-2f76597
```

This was built from source on Gentoo Linux manually, because there's no ebuild available :-(

data.title: Subclassing `TextEditor` and overriding `getViewClass` does not work as expected
data.body:
Scenario:  I am writing an atom package in which I define a custom subclass of `TextEditor` and `TextEditorView`.  I have overridden `getViewClass` on my `TextEditor` subclass to return my subclass of `TextEditorView`.

Expected:  When returning an instance of my `TextEditor` subclass from a custom file opener, I expect the view that is created to be my custom subclassed view

Actual:  A generic TextEditorView is created instead of my custom subclass

Reasoning:  `ViewRegistry::findProvider` does not handle subclassing as expected.  It will match on the first registered model constructor that matches against the provided object, meaning that the`{TextEditor, TextEditorView}` registration is matched because `(MySubclass instanceof TextEditor) == true`

Workaround:  manually unshift my view provider onto `ViewRegister::providers` so that the search hits it first.

---

Would it make sense to change `ViewRegister::createView` such that the model's getViewClass is checked prior to the `findProvider` flow?  If we did that, IMO it makes for a more understandable behavior when dealing with subclassed models/views.  I'd be happy to work up a patch if, if so.

data.title: atom -w requires the entire window be closed, not just the tab
data.body: This is slightly inconvenient when one uses `atom -w` for things like git commit messages, it'd be great if just closing the tab that was opened was enough to cause the process to exit.

data.title: Missing directory name when multiple files with same name in different tab groups
data.body:
Using 0.174.0 on windows

When opening multiple files of the same name, the directory name is appended to the tab to allow the user to differentiate which version of the file each tab represents. 

This behaviour does not appear to work between different editor panes, the attachment below shows 3 .jshintrc files, the ones on the left correctly displaying the folder name (as it has two files called .jshintrc), while the third one in other pane (being the only .jshintrc in its window). If there is only one .jshintrc on each pane then they both do not show the folder name.

(.jshintrc is unrelated to the issue it just happened to be a file I had three of in a repository)

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4512498/5790160/f689b076-9e83-11e4-87cf-64fd9823f6bd.PNG)

Expected behaviour: folder name should be displayed if tab filename is not unique across all tabs, not just the tabs on that editor pane. This is how sublime behaves.

data.title: PHP files incorrectly identified as HTML
data.body:
If I have an PHP file with a `.php` extension that contains only HTML, the editor identifies it as HTML (as shown in the status bar). This becomes an issue because even after some php code is added (within `<?php ?>` tags) the editor does not update the file type and syntax highlighting does not get enabled for PHP. I have to manually change the file type to PHP to get correct syntax highlighting.

Are there any fixes for this, or am I doing something wrong?

data.title: Crashes when opening any file.
data.body: Im using the latest version of atom with no packages on a Mac latest version and whenever I open a file with atom it crashes.

data.title: Renaming open file or directory makes copy
data.body:
Right-click in the tree view to rename a file (which is currently open in the editor) and the file gets copied/duplicated to the new name while the old file remains open. They are not symlinked as editing one does not produce changes in the other after closing/reopening.

Renaming a directory (containing a file open in the editor) has similar effect. The old directory remains, including any files currently open in the editor. Everything else is moved to the new directory, including copies of open files.

Atom 0.170 on OS X 10.10. Has been happening for a while, and happens even when all plugins are disabled. I tested by opening my Desktop folder in Atom, creating a folder and some files, and renaming the folder while with some files open.

data.title: Fix typo in addOpener doc
Replace the lipstick emoji for formatting changes
data.body:
With the aim of being a bit more inclusive, this PR changes the suggested emoji indicating a style or formatting change from :lipstick: to :art:.

Fixes #5111
